node.doctext:
[Black Street. No Trade. Gypsies!]
[Blank Page]


-----=====######=====-----


two young men on a rooftop
of [sun] and [shingle] [tar]
below a [kitten] curls up
by a [baby in a jar]

"remember back in [high school] days
when [everything] made sense
when we only spoke of things to come
and thought in [future tense]?"

"i [remember] all these things
but [memory is a fool]
now i just let those days slide by
and try to [play it cool]"

two young men in the [basement]
watching [lights] shift on the walls
old [ghosts] haunt the rooms above
while through floor vents [music falls]

"everything is changing
from one minute to the next
i suppose they will [forever]
but i'm not taking any bets"

"we're [pirates] of our destiny
and eminent is change
but we're the only ones at fault
for making life so [strange]"

two young men and a shovel
walking down the beach
one [killing] and one [burying]
every living thing in reach

"[i never thought it'd be like this]
[death] on a sunny day
but look what we've now come to
and the silly games we play"

"every man is thought a [fool]
before he rounds the bend
but every man is [wiser]
at the journey's end"

two young men on a gravel dock
in the middle of the [night]
watching water lap the [shoreline]
and the dancing city lights

"my life's become a [fairytale]
i've been thinking all in [rhyme]
of a world of [truckstop hairdressers]
where art is considered crime"

"[art is crime] and [pain is truth]
and the bottom is the top
and these things are not only true
where hairdressers work truckstops"

two young men on a mountain
how much better can it get
two young men on a [railroad] [bridge]
"[are we tripping yet?]"

two young men perform [miracles]
in a [fantastic], made-up world
two young men chasing [candy],
[cigarettes] and [girls]

two young men working overtime
living young men's dreams
two young men do the best they can
in a world where [nothing's as it seems]

We never said it was [easy], never said it was [fun]
when the party is all over and the [damage] is all done
[we tried to tell you] but never got through
"do as we say and not as we do"
we warned of the [poison] hidden in the cup
paging through the phone book and looking old friends up
we said that being [lonely] is better than [alone]
it's useless to look back now, [you never can go home]
we spoke to you of all these things but [listen] you did not
now in the [mirror] we'll remind you and in your [dreams] these thoughts will [rot].



-[the gilded frame]-
--[The Snake Eyed Man]--
node.title: Do as we say and not as we do.
